content.description:
Fun route and relatively easy for most of the route. The crux is at the top with a high reach to a volume-like horn that comes out by the crack.

I'm fairly new to climbing so I'm not totally sure how accurate my rating is.
content.location: Get on top of Dixie rock and head toward the far Southeast corner. There are two anchor bolts near of the cliff by a crack.

content.description: open project.  start low and work your way up pumpy moves to right traverse along several crimpers and then top out
content.location: south side of dixie rock on south facing side of the north wall next to the path that leads to the steps up dixie rock.

content.description:
The good: Really fun holds, side pulls, and pockets.

The bad: it faces south, so it's hot. Lots of broken glass at the base (be careful with your shoes!). The paint used to paint Dixie made for one slippery hold.

This is a popular rappelling spot, but it's also a really fun climb.
content.location:
This route is at the famous Dixie Overlook, in St. George, UT.

goo.gl/maps/cqryl

To start the route, hike to the top of the the overlook and set up your rope. You'll want at least 2 8ft slings, a little bit longer would be good, to hang a carabiner over the ledge (minimizing wear on the rope). You can walk down the trail, towards the parking lot, and around to get to the base of the cliff.

The route is just left of the D for "Dixie".

content.description: Cave area with lots of routes and variations. Offers great summer shade.  If you know of anything established, please let us know.
content.location: Enter cave on the North East most corner of dixie rock.

content.description: Short TR route that provides a few variations - either friction climbing to climber's left or some small huecos on the right.
content.protection: TR only. Three bolts found on top. Recommend some longer sling to prevent rope drag.
content.location: This route sits directly across from the popular traverse boulder problems in Pioneer Park.
